thig6.1:0.3_0: Paṭācārā, Who Had a Following of Five Hundred
thig6.1:1.1_0: “He whose path you do not know,
thig6.1:1.2_0: whence they came or where they went;
thig6.1:1.3_0: though he came from who knows where,
thig6.1:2.1_0: But one whose path you do know,
thig6.1:2.2_0: whence they came or where they went;
thig6.1:2.3_0: that one you do not lament—
thig6.1:2.4_0: for living beings on the teaching.
thig6.1:3.3_0: He must have come from somewhere,
thig6.1:3.4_0: and stayed who knows how many days.
thig6.1:3.5_0: He left from here by one road,
thig6.1:3.6_0: he will go from there by another.
thig6.1:4.1_0: Departing with the form of a human,
thig6.1:4.3_0: As he came, so he went:
thig6.1:5.1_0: “Give me permission to such a dart
thig6.1:5.3_0: You’ve swept away the grief for my son,
thig6.1:5.4_0: in which I once was mired.
thig6.1:6.3_0: Revering the Buddha and the teaching,
thig6.1:6.4_0: to his teaching, and to the Sangha.”
thig6.1:7.1_0: That is how Paṭācārā, who had a following of five hundred, declared her enlightenment.
